did.abstract: In 1981, Dr. Ronald Sigler was appointed to the Classifications and Rating Administration Board of the Motion Picture Association of America, the first librarian to serve on the board. The collection consists of film rating forms, clippings, memos, communications, information related to Richard Heffner, Chairmanof the Classification Ratings Administration.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Ronald Floyd Sigler was born in 1932 in Brooklyn, New York. He Earned a B.A. in music from Queens College (1956), Masters of Library Science from UCLA (1964), and Ph.D. in Library Science from Florida State University (1977); his Ph.D. dissertation concerned film censorship. From 1958 to 1964, he worked with the Buena Park Library District as the head of the Audio-Visual department, and was the Audio-Visual Coordinator for the County of Los Angeles Library system from 1965 to 1973. From 1975 to 1981, Sigler taught in the School of Library Science at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee. In 1977 he was asked to draft a Freedom to View Statement by the Education Film Library Association (EFLA) which was adopted by EFLA and the American Library Association. In 1981, Sigler was appointed to the Classification and Rating Administration (CARA) Board of the Motion Picture Association of America, the first librarian to serve on the board. CARA is responsible to issue ratings for motion pictures which are exhibited and distributed commercially in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of files related to Ronald Sigler's work with the Classification and Rating Administration (CARA) of the Motion Picture Association of America from circa 1981-1983. Included are rating forms, clippings, memos and communications, a small number of printed items about the rating system, and materials related to Richard Heffner, Chairman of CARA. The bulk of the ratings forms, clippings, memos and communications are photocopies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of photocopies of film rating forms representing a variety of motion pictures. Information on the forms mostly include: name of the rater, a brief summary of the film's content, rating, and justification. The forms were completed by Ronald Sigler and Albert Van Schmus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series comprises one folder of photocopied memorandum, correspondence, and notes to and from Richard Heffner, Chairman of the Classification Ratings Administration. Some memorandum appear to be observations from film raters outlining how they evaluate films. Of note is a statement by Heffner for the Subcommittee on Special and Small Business Problems of the Committee on Small Business of the United States House of Representatives.

scopecontent.p: The series comprises one folder of photocopied interoffice memos and general communications pertaining to the classification and ratings of motion pictures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of assorted clippings from newspapers, magazines, and/or journals related to motion picture ratings and the ratings system. The bulk of the materials are photocopies. Publications include The Hollywood Reporter, Los Angeles Times, New York Times, TV Guide, and Variety. Also included is an article written by Sigler titled, Building an Intellectual Freedom Policy for Video Collections.
